name: Schoolhouse Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Located a 10min walk along a street of dreary, nondescript office buildings from the lovely Marrion Square gardens with its statue of Oscar Wilde, the School House is a pleasant, comfortable small hotel in a C19th former parochial school. The main school buildings are now popular bar and equally popular restaurant with most of the guest rooms in a newer addition at the rear of the building. There is a nice garden terrace at the front with the restored canal to the side of the main building,
reviews.title: Old school feel with nice bar/restaurant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room described as a suite, was relatively small due being in the gable roof with sloping roof walls, small windows and several large pieces of free standing furniture limiting the usable area. The style was comfortable-contemporary rather than modern or in keeping with the building architecture or history. The bed was very warm and comfortable with good quality linen, but the bathroom was a strictly one person space, with narrow bath which coupled with protruding shower controls and shower curtain made showering a challenge.
reviews.title: Quaint yet elegant

reviews.text: Free Wifi, TV with free movies and coffee/tea making facilities (instant, not espresso) were welcome, as well as the ironing board, but I don’t know anyone these days who uses a trouser press.
reviews.title: Better than expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfasts after the first day’s rather over-cooked eggs and depleted buffet, were very good, with good choice and well presented, and an evening meal amid the rafters of the old school hall was excellent. Staff were helpful, friendly and efficient.
reviews.title: "They've done their homework!

reviews.text: In summary, a slightly off-centre location, made up for by free parking - (why is Dublin the only city where you can only get rental cars at the airport and not downtown?), and a comfortable rather than luxurious standard of accommodation, enhanced by good food and a busy bar.
reviews.title: It was simply perfect.

reviews.text: I have stayed here most weeks from last OCtober to this April and can recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a relaxed stay in Dublin. Ok it doesn't have swimming pool or gym but it does have great food. The rooms are well equiped with comfortable beds and all the necessary toiletries etc.
reviews.title: relaxed comfortable hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff are very helpful and help to create the welcoming relaxed atmosphere of this hotel
reviews.title: Excellent Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I loved our night away. The hotel was delightful. The staff were friendly. The band were great with a brilliant mix of old and new. All in all top notch. The only downside, the next morning the waitress was a little snappy, however I mentioned this to the Manager and she was very understanding and listened well. I came away with an overall great feeling about the hotel. We did eat in the restaurant the night before and the food was nice and very reasonable. The waitress serving us was friendly and helpful. I would highly recomend this hotel and definitely would go again.
reviews.title: Rough start!

reviews.text: I have to say that we were off to a rough start at the Schoolhouse Hotel in Dublin when we arrived early to check in. We were told in a rather abrupt way that check in was not until 3. I think this could have been handled in a better way- maybe a hello first.
reviews.title: Hotel Gem

reviews.text: But things did pick up from there. We had a beautiful, quiet room for two nights. It was clean and we had lots of room to organize our return home packing. The room was very quiet.
reviews.title: Old school newer hotel

reviews.text: I enjoyed my stay overall. Their single beds seemed a bit larger than your average single and they were very comfortable. (I stayed with a freind and had two singles). My one complaint would be that they advertise free parking available in their parking lot, but they don't tell you that their are limitted spaces, so if you arrive when the lot is full, you have to park on the street and keep feeding the meter. Other than that, it was a nice stay in a very good location.
reviews.title: Nice place

reviews.text: Having stayed here many times, this hotel just gets better and better..the rooms remain quiet and no matter which one you get, you feel like never leaving. It's a step back in ye olde English worlde charm with excellent pies ( beef and Guiness is the best!) , lovely bathrooms and a huge bed. It's in the best part of Dublin and if it wasn't so in demand, i would stay here every time. It can get expensive at times but it's really worth it.My only complaint this time was the housekeeping .. It was so late in the day. Other than that, just great!
reviews.title: A country home in the city

reviews.text: This Schoolhouse Hotel is an absolute Gem. The Management of the Hotel by Irene was superb! She was totally present to us at every step of the Journey. Whether it was changing a light bulb or booking a taxi, or parking an oversized Van, Irene was always accomodating to our Group. The service at the desk, and in the Dining area, was superb. All the staff totally go out of their way to provide outstanding service. We booked for two nights upon arrival in Dublin in advance, and then two nights upon our departure. Coming back after our Journey to Cork, it truly felt like coming home to Schoolhouse. The food and service in the Hotel was so exceptional that we dined there every evening. I cannot say enough about the management of this Hotel. I thank Irene, and Brian, and Zoe, and Indira, and all others who provided such an amazing restful experience! I will definitely stay here the next time we are in Dublin for us . Five Star!! Ten Star! Top of the rating scale! Thank You!!! You made all the difference in an wonderful stay!!
reviews.title: Fabulous hotel experience!!!

reviews.text: Having heard great things about this hotel I was eager to stay here. We stayed here last weekend while enjoying a weekend trip to Dublin. On arrival there were no car spaces so we spent some time looking for some which naturally when you park else where you also have to pay. Not the fault of the hotel but there is only room for about 30 spaces ( maybe less). Check in was good and we made our way to our room. The room was freezing on arrival and took ages to warm. We decided to eat in the restaurant before heading into town. I must say the menu was lovely and my food was perfect. My friends however felt there's was a bit cold but they did not mention this to the waitress. On reflection they should have. After a wonderful night out we made our way to the bar. Bar was quiet but the staff were very friendly and we enjoyed our time there.
reviews.title: Nice but over rated and needs some TLC

reviews.text: On going back to our room it was still freezing and the walls are paper thin, we could hear through the walls and so we had a very restless night.
reviews.title: Full of character

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Schoolhouse Hotel was a charming place to stay for our night in Dublin. The rooms are beautifully decorated and quiet, and the free wifi, parking, and coffee is a great plus. The location is close to central Dublin (within a 15 minute walk or so) and is in a quiet part of town, just off a pretty canal. We enjoyed our breakfast the next morning as well -- we were offered a choice of options for a "hot" breakfast plate and were able to take advantage of a range of fruit, breads and biscuits. We also ate at the restaurant for dinner the night before -- the food at dinner was above average but unfortunately our waitress was very slow and inattentive. (For example, it took over an hour to receive our appetizers, and we had to constantly flag down the waitress or another waiter to receive water, etc.) That said, however, the dinner experience did not diminish our feelings about the Schoolhouse as a hotel and we would gladly stay there again when in Dublin again.
reviews.title: Good location, excellent accommodation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for 3 nights in April 2013. Check in was easy thanks to Zoe. Given room with poor Wi Fi access and because we had the window open, we could smell smoke from the staff from the restaurant on their break who were directly below the window. Happily we changed rooms. WI Fi better and no smoke from below.
reviews.title: Good location and accommodation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bed good room, room large. We ate at the bar each night which was more than adequate Bar staff were great.
reviews.title: excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfasts in the morning was interesting. Morning one plenty of staff provided great service. Second and third days were much different. Waitress on day 2 was on her own and stressed. She forgot to bring milk with the coffee and was tardy in taking orders. Day 3, my wife was provided scrambled eggs instead the fried as she ordered. They need to swap the bar staff with the breakfast staff.
reviews.title: Quite Superb

reviews.text: Overall a good experience but not sure if I would return.
reviews.title: Charming, could have been better, much better!

description: In a class of its own... For those seeking somewhere truly different in Dublin, The Schoolhouse Hotel Ballsbridge is definitely ahead of its class, one of the leading D4 hotels. Unique, intimate and ideally located, the four star Schoolhouse Hotel in Ballsbridge Dublin 4 exudes a warm and friendly atmosphere. Described as a hidden gem in Dublin city this D4 hotel is located just 10 minutes walk from many of Dublin's main visitor attractions: the fashionable area of Grafton Street, Trinity College, Temple Bar, St. Stephen's Green, The National Museum, The R.D.S and Landsdowne / Aviva Stadium. Boasting luxury d4 hotel accommodation in Ballsbridge, each of our rooms have Super King Size Double Beds or Deluxe Twin Single Beds and include a host of luxury extras such as Full Irish breakfast in the comfort of your room or at The Restaurant in The Schoolhouse, on site Car Parking, Mineral Water, Tea, Coffee & Cookies, Movies, Email & Internet on your plasma television, Luxury toiletries and a Schoolhouse bathrobe on request. As one of the best Ballsbridge hotels Ireland has to offer you will be in a haven of luxury at the Schoolhouse Hotel.
